name: office-add-in-sso-aspnet
title: Office Add-in that supports Single Sign-on to Office, the add-in, and Microsoft Graph
shortDescription: This sample implements an Office Add-in that uses the getAccessToken API in Office.js to give the add-in access to Microsoft Graph data. This sample is built on ASP.NET and Microsoft Authentication Library (MSAL) .NET.
longDescription: This sample implements an Office Add-in that uses the getAccessToken API in Office.js to give the add-in access to Microsoft Graph data. This sample is built on ASP.NET and Microsoft Authentication Library (MSAL) .NET.

references.name: Create an ASP.NET Office Add-in that uses single sign-on
references.description: When users are signed in to Office, your add-in can use the same credentials to permit users to access multiple applications without requiring them to sign in a second time. This article walks you through the process of enabling single sign-on (SSO) in an add-in that is built with ASP.NET.
